report_title: Billboard and Sign Manufacturing Industry Report
executive_summary: Online media has challenged many traditional alternatives to billboards, like newspapers and magazines, slowly seeping into billboard advertising. Nonetheless, advertisers have continued to value Billboard and Sign Manufacturing industry products to reach mass audiences in an increasingly fragmented media landscape, benefiting demand for the industry. The effects of the pandemic undermined industry revenue in 2020 as downstream demand declined broadly, reducing advertising expenditure and business formation. The pandemic has also significantly hindered nonresidential construction spending, reducing demand for general signage from commercial, public and institutional facilities. While advertising budgets have bounced back and boosted demand for the industry, revenue declined at a CAGR of 2.7% to $14.5 billion in 2024, including a pitfall of 2.1% in 2024 alone as profit settles at 3.6%.

current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Outdoor advertising through billboards and other displays has remained one of the most viable traditional advertising formats, sustaining demand for industry manufacturers. This durability has not extended to every product in the industry, as the emergence of digital billboards has reduced some demand for print billboards.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: The Pandemic Has Undermined Demand From Downstream Industries
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The industry is reliant on retailers and businesses. In 2020, industry revenue fell due to economic volatility stemming from the pandemic. Restrictions placed during the pandemic limited consumer activity, reducing demand for new billboards and signs.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Digital Billboards Become the Favorite, Premium Option
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Digital billboards use high-resolution digital video screens or LEDs. The industry has produced more digital displays because they are more profitable than traditional billboards. As costs of components have declined, profit in this segment has increased.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Even as Advertising Budgets Recover, the Economic Slowdown Will Limit Growth
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The industry's downstream clients will put the pandemic in their rearview mirror as corporate profit is anticipated to rise and so are advertising budgets. Companies will be encouraged by strong commercial activity to replace worn billboards and displays, which will lead to an increase in outdoor advertising expenditures.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Digital Billboards Offer an Opportunity to Improve Profitability
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Revenue from digital billboards, high-definition video displays and LED displays will drive the industry, even as advertising mediums continue to change. LED screens are becoming more affordable, enabling smaller businesses to invest in digital signage solutions.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Regulation Could Curtail the Digital Future
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: As new digital billboards have been erected in US cities, many local lawmakers have sought to limit billboard advertising through new municipal regulations. New policies have included takedown rules, under which outdoor advertising companies must remove a prescribed square foot of traditional advertising space for every square foot of new digital billboard space installed.

industry_definition: This industry manufactures billboards, scoreboards, retail store signage and transit station advertising displays. Products include nonelectric signs, digital billboards, video screens and neon signs.
key_trends: Manufacturers focus on providing quality products to combat price competition. Customer loyalty to existing manufacturers makes it difficult for new companies to attract clients.
Despite the proliferation of social media, demand for billboards and signs has remained durable. Outdoor signs remain one of the few viable ways to reach a broad, mass audience.
The pandemic resulted in a severe dip in traditional economic activity across downstream markets. In response, spending on new billboards and signs dropped precipitously in 2020.
Digital billboards are becoming popular because they can host multiple advertisements. Their complexity makes them highly value-added, allowing manufacturers to reap higher profit.

The scale of billboard and sign manufacturers is limited by the regional nature of the industry. Companies typically work regionally to meet specific client needs, and their scale determines the distribution of products.

The vast majority of companies in the industry are small and medium-sized manufacturers. Nearly three-quarters of them have fewer than ten employees, and no single company has captured more than 5.0% of the market.

The fortunes of billboard manufacturers are affected by laws at the federal, state and local levels. As products have evolved, some states and localities have imposed more stringent regulations on billboards and sign size and placement.
Profitability greatly varies between more prominent and smaller local companies. After declining at the height of the COVID-19 pandemic, profitability has recovered in line with downstream demand.

Labor is essential to the manufacturing process in this industry. The emergence of digital signage has driven the need for more technically competent staff, with component integration and wiring work still handled manually.

Manufacturers are located across the United States, with a significant presence in most regions and densely populated cities. Many manufacturers locate near end markets because the cost of transporting heavy, bulky billboards is high.

market_segmentation.segment_description: The industry's largest market is retailers, accommodation and food services. Like most physical businesses, retailers and restaurants require general signage to publicize their services to potential customers. Restaurants purchase more signage than businesses in other industries since they often list menu items alongside photographs or additional descriptions. Retail establishments tend to be close to other businesses in high-traffic areas, so signage can be crucial in advertising their products and driving potential customers to their stores in a competitive environment.

Outdoor advertising agencies purchase billboards to rent display space for other businesses' marketing efforts. Products sold to this market include billboards, which cost tens of thousands of dollars and require significant manufacturing capabilities to produce. Advertising agencies purchase digital billboards, enabling agencies to toggle advertiser messages and generate more revenue per individual billboard. Digital billboards offer a suite of customization options, making them a more flexible alternative to traditional billboards. This segment also includes transit agencies, which purchase a great deal of digital signage to convey timely information like weather advisories and departure times. Government agencies, particularly in major cities, may also purchase larger billboards to publicize public service announcements or rent display space to advertisers.

The corporate and trade show segment includes signage related to commercial office buildings and displays and exhibits produced for corporate conferences. Corporate conferences are a steady market, though they are cyclical because they tend to be a discretionary business expense afforded in growth periods. Demand from corporate and trade shows moves roughly in line with nonresidential construction. The construction of new office space goes hand in hand with demand for signage, typically a one-time expense.

Other markets are a large segment because signage is demanded by a wide array of businesses and special events. Due to its breadth and scope, the variety of clientele this segment represents protects it against any volatile changes. Some of this segment's most notable other markets include convenience stores, healthcare, hospitality, education and financial services.

products_and_services.product_description: This segment includes nonelectric signs of all sizes, including 3D billboards, trade show exhibits and storefront signage purchased by most brick-and-mortar businesses.

Digital billboards and signs incorporate LEDs, plasma display panels or projection screens into billboards and advertising displays. Through interactive interfaces, digital signage can enhance a customer's retail experience, and the information displayed is computer-programmed and can be changed instantly.
Other products this industry manufactures include neon signs, countertop displays, removable letters for marquees, and sidewalk signs.

demand_determinants.determinant_description: Total advertising expenditure directly boosts the billboard and sign manufacturing industry. Increased ad spending drives demand for outdoor advertising, translating into more orders for signage. Any inclines to total advertising expenditures represent a potential opportunity for the industry.

All companies are more likely to increase their marketing, advertising and rebranding budgets when their profit is substantial. As profit rises, businesses invest more in advertising, increasing demand for billboards and signs.

The value of private nonresidential construction directly fuels the billboard and sign manufacturing industry. When construction projects such as commercial buildings, retail spaces and office complexes increase, there's a spike in demand for corresponding signage solutions.

The percentage of services conducted online measures the proportion of online services conducted by consumers. When more services are conducted online, it reduces demand at brick-and-mortar businesses that would traditionally demand signage.

international_trade_points.trade_title: Imports are limited by local need
international_trade_points.trade_description: Billboards and signs are manufactured with a high degree of customization, which gives local companies willing to foster an intimate relationship with clients, a significant advantage in downstream markets.

international_trade_points.trade_title: China is a leading importer, despite fluctuations
international_trade_points.trade_description: Imports from China account for nearly half of all industry goods imported into the United States. Nonetheless, imported goods from China fell in 2019 and 2020 because of trade restrictions levied by the Trump Administration and the decline in economic output as a result of the COVID-19 outbreak.

The required customization for local markets and the high transportation costs associated with heavy signs, especially billboards, limit their exports. Less than 1.0% of domestically manufactured products are sold overseas.

international_trade_points.trade_title: A decline in exports is poised to aboutface
international_trade_points.trade_description: Recently, US signage products, such as billboards, have become less competitive in the global market, with other countries opting to import from low-cost Asian competitors. An expected decline in the trade-weighted index, coupled with domestic manufacturers focusing on higher-quality products rather than competing in price, could help reverse the decline in exports.

business_locations.location_description: The Southeast is a manufacturing hub. The Southeast has the most significant number of billboard and sign manufacturers. In addition to its regional importance as a population center, the Southeast is home to many of the country's manufacturing facilities due to its lower labor costs.

Manufacturers locate in the West because of its large, concentrated population centers and significant manufacturing capacity. The West region also offers strategic proximity to key ports via the Pacific and trade partners Canada and Mexico. California dominates the West region due to its high-density areas, providing optimal locations for the success of billboard and sign manufacturing businesses.
The Great Lakes has a substantial distribution of sign manufacturers. Many manufacturers locate near end markets because the cost of transporting heavy, bulky billboards is high.
The Mid-Atlantic has a substantial distribution of sign manufacturers. Many manufacturers locate near end markets because the cost of transporting heavy, bulky billboards is high.
The Southwest has a substantial distribution of sign manufacturers. Many manufacturers locate near end markets because the cost of transporting heavy, bulky billboards is high.
The Plains region has some billboard and sign manufacturing establishments.
The Rocky Mountains region has some billboard and sign manufacturing establishments.
The New England region has no billboard and sign manufacturing establishments mentioned.

regulations_points.regulation_description: The Highway Beautification Act of 1965 (HBA) regulated outdoor advertising on Federal-Aid Primary, Interstate and National Highway System roads.

All states have billboard control statutes and regulations at least as restrictive as the federal requirements, including laws requiring the removal of illegal signs at the owner's expense (and without state compensation).
Certain municipalities have stringent laws regarding certain kinds of signs and billboards.
The rules around digital signage are still being developed. Some states have implemented laws to limit the brightness of digital billboards.

barriers_points.barrier_description: New entrants must comply with general manufacturing regulations. Government regulations do not directly inhibit industry entrance, but many cities restrict the placement and number of billboards and related products within their borders.
Most sign companies operate in small local markets, resulting in modest capital requirements for newcomers.

New entrants must persuade clients to shift away from dependable brand names and purchase new products. Customer loyalty to existing manufacturers can make it difficult for new companies to attract customers.
While automation decreases the labor needed to manufacture signs and billboards, skilled and knowledgeable employees are required in the manufacturing process.

basis_points.basis_description: Manufacturers focus on providing quality products to combat price competition. Customer loyalty to existing manufacturers makes it difficult for new companies to attract clients.
Despite the proliferation of social media, demand for billboards and signs has remained durable. Outdoor signs remain one of the few viable ways to reach a broad, mass audience.

concentration_points.concentration_title: Most manufacturers are small and cater to local markets
concentration_points.concentration_description: Most billboard and sign manufacturers are local companies and depend on deep personal connections between company management and the local customer base.

concentration_points.concentration_title: Specialized Niches Create Opportunities for Scale
concentration_points.concentration_description: A few companies operate in highly specialized product niches, like digital scoreboards, that offer a national customer base and lend themselves to large-scale manufacturing operations.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: High Purchase Costs and Limited Buying Power
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Billboard and sign manufacturers purchase plastics, aluminum, wire and other manufactured products, making purchase costs the most significant expense for manufacturers in this industry.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: While automation decreases the labor needed to manufacture signs and billboards, skilled and knowledgeable employees are required.

volatility_points.volatility_title: Total Advertising Expenditure Has a Significant Impact on Volatility
volatility_points.volatility_description: Demand for advertising and signage from end-user industries drives the need for billboards and signs.

volatility_points.volatility_title: Economic Performance is an Essential Determinant of Advertising Spending
volatility_points.volatility_description: Consumer and business sentiment significantly influence Billboard and Sign Manufacturing revenue volatility.

technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Digital billboards incorporate LEDs, plasma display panels or projection screens into billboards and advertising displays.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: Manufacturers Use Innovative Methods to Cater to New Markets
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Modern printers offer higher resolutions, ensuring crisp, clear imagery and text that stand out.

FAQs.question: How is your company impacted by rising imports from abroad?
FAQs.answer: Billboards and signs are bulky, which limits international transportation, so the industry faces minimal import competition.

FAQs.question: Are your company's sales heavily dependent on the health of the US economy?
FAQs.answer: Signage demand moves in line with key macroeconomic barometers such as nonresidential construction investment, business formation and advertising expenditure.

FAQs.question: Is your company investing heavily in R&D to meet changing consumer preferences?
FAQs.answer: The industry's fastest-growing product segment is digital billboards, which are constantly evolving with new technology.

FAQs.question: How often do you deliver orders on time? If you've missed deadlines in the past, how have you mitigated the situation?
FAQs.answer: Timely product delivery is particularly important in the northern part of the United States where billboard and sign installation is often impossible during winter and early spring due to severe weather.
